title: How to Reduce Solid Waste

steps.headline: Purchase items in bulk.
steps.description: Products that are packaged in larger packages typically use less packaging per product than smaller packages. Check this out the next time you are shopping.

steps.headline: Analyze the size of the packaging for the products you buy.
steps.description: Choose to buy items that use no packaging or a minimal amount of packaging. For example, buy apples from a bin rather than wrapped up on styrofoam with plastic around them.

steps.headline: Buy items that are packaged in recycled cartons.
Choose to purchase items that are made from recycled products.
steps.description: Most things made from recycled products advertise this fact, so that you know you are helping the environment when you purchase them.

steps.headline: Recycle items rather than sending them to the landfill.
steps.description: Keep a recycle bin or bag in your home to place plastic, paper and cans. Carry these recycle items to your recycling station. Some towns offer curb side recycling.

steps.headline: Place food scraps in a compost bin.
steps.description: You can also use newspaper and other biodegradable items to make compost.

steps.headline: Carry cloth bags to the grocery store or market.
steps.description: Use these bags in place of plastic or paper bags that will be thrown away. Reuse the cloth bags each time you shop.

steps.headline: Give items to charity or sell in a yard sale rather than throwing them away.
steps.description: Sometimes, 1 person's trash is another person's treasure. This is a wonderful way to recycle items.

steps.headline: Find a way to reuse items rather than throwing them away.
steps.description: An example would be to wash and reuse plastic containers rather than using plastic baggies and throwing them in the trash.

steps.headline: Reuse items for a different purpose than originally intended.
steps.description: For example, make a pencil holder out of a metal can.

steps.headline: Check to see if the packaging you are about to throw away can be returned for refill.
steps.description: Soft drink bottles sometimes offer a deposit for returning to the store. Computer ink cartridges can be returned and refilled.

steps.headline: Pick up only what you need.
steps.description: Avoid throwing items away unnecessarily. Borrow items that you might only use occasionally. Try to fix an item rather than throwing it away, or see if someone else can fix it for you.

steps.headline: Recharge batteries rather than using disposable.
steps.description: You will save money in the long run and keep these items out of landfills.

steps.headline: Teach others about the benefits of reducing solid waste.
steps.description: Talk about reducing solid waste in the schools and at community events. Promote ways to reduce solid waste in public service announcements on the radio and television.
